website_summaries.verdict: The Linksys EA7500 Max-Stream AC1900 MU-MIMO Gigabit Router delivers speedy dual-band and MU-MIMO performance, and offers a solid array of ports and management settings.

customer_reviews.title: Amazon shipping someone's returns.  Again.
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a nice enough router, except for the fact it was already set up for someone else's internet. So obviously a return that Amazon palmed off as new. Wiped it and set it up again, worked OK, but lots of missing features that made it difficult to use. So, returning it to Amazon, but I'll wipe it so the next customer they sell it to doesn't have to...
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. M. Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Died a few months out of warrenty
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to use, but lacked some advanced features, range was okay, speed with multiple devices admittedly was good, but ran very very hot and just a few months after the warranty expired it just died so sign of life in the device at all :/
customer_reviews.author: Typicalsardine

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with chromebooks
customer_reviews.text: The router allows to plug on USB3 a file system but unfortunately the SMB protocol used is too old and not safe. As is it is not safe, only new version of SMB protocol is alloweb in ChromeOS. The Linksys support told me they know the issue, it could be corrected but there is no plan on that for FW update. As Chomebooks grows, I am surprised that Linksys sells products with obsolete unsafe protocol. I will change this comment if Linksys solves this issue one day :-(
customer_reviews.author: Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: not supported by firmware updates
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router in 2016...... since then it has received exactly 1 firmware update in August 2017. So in 4 years 1 update......seeing how many vulnerabilities there are found on a regular basis, I don't think this router is up to scratch regarding security with a firmware dating back to 2017. Linksys doesn't seem interested, so I would not recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Jamzi

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had got this sooner
customer_reviews.text: I wish I’d got this sooner. Been struggling with a Superhub for a while now that kept cutting out because of my NAS (as well as randomly). Now put it into modem mode and connected it to this and all is well since installing two weeks ago. Easy to set up. (Worth googling connecting superhub on modem mode). Software on phone is excellent. You can activate WPS mode from your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: im useless at these things and it took a couple of ...
customer_reviews.text: not too complicated to set up. im useless at these things and it took a couple of attempts, but i could probably say that about any router i chose. when setup it has performed flawlessly for months now.. only dropped out a couple of times and immediately reconnected. i have experienced very little lag (much, much less than the previous router) and this is more down to our cheap service rather than the router. no problem recommending this one
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, easy to configure - love it!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced by old Cisco router with this. It is expensive, but it is amazing. Very reliable, easy to configure, with a great app for managing it. Works well with the AC1900+ range extender. Very easy to set up, and the advanced setup options allow you to configure it in great detail if needed. Has worked without missing a beat, and delivering great reliability and performance for a month or two now. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: croftonstorage

customer_reviews.title: Didn't improve wi-fi
customer_reviews.text: I spent some time on the phone to the tech team and the end result was that the lady thought I should be grateful for getting 1mb more on my download speed and I was told it would not improve my wifi. A lot of money for 1mb more so sent it back. Didn't do what it said on the box for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lamped

customer_reviews.title: Great router for a decent price
customer_reviews.text: Got one of these as we live in a house with lots of thick walls and our sky router wasn't great at getting signal to the whole house. Setup was pretty easy and now we get decent coverage around the whole house.
customer_reviews.author: P. Rosser

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Despite claims the signal would be strong, this product was very poor with frequent drop outs and poor connection capability, leading me to return it buying a Netgear router instead. I bought this product after my old Linksys router gave up the ghost after many years reliable service. Sadly it is clear since the Linksys company was sold the quality has dropped so give this router a wide berth.
customer_reviews.author: Mr N

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and great coverage.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy setup for a novice user, pretty much 'plug n play. But also the more advanced features that are setup via a laptop via Ethernet are all easy to understand. I now have a happy house with all wifi users getting good signal strength. Just one tip, try a few different orientations of the device and antenna angles to get the best coverage as even rotating 90 degrees can win or lose range to certain parts of the house. Now have 60meg in the room with the router and 20meg at the furthest room in quite a large house. This is way better than the basic 2.4GHz router that my ISP provided when we signed up for fibre broadband.
customer_reviews.author: Snorkelbat

customer_reviews.title: A must have for virgin media hub
customer_reviews.text: Virgin hub didn't give me a great WiFi signal even with boosters. This router improves the signal between my virgin TV boxes upstairs and downstairs with no errors since I've been using it. Easy to set up and a great app. I changed the WiFi name and password to the same as my virgin modem/router so I didn't need to re-add all devices. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Roye

customer_reviews.title: Good value from Amazon Warehouse
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Good value from Amazon Warehouse Update: after a few months of use the router keeps dropping its WiFi signal and leaves us unable to access the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Goodman109

customer_reviews.title: so if there is a bug that's annoying you, it will be there forever without mentioning ...
customer_reviews.text: Wifi signal, not that stable, also for MAC USERS this router is not COMPATIBLE WITH TIME MACHINE via the USB port on the router, LINKSYS is the only brand that doesn't support it! Also, don't expect firmware update are there is none. Compare to Asus were they release firmware update on monthly to bimonthly pattern, so if there is a bug that's annoying you, it will be there forever without mentioning security holes not patched up. for that price range I would stay away from it !
customer_reviews.author: TOMAS

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research on this , but really got it wrong. This product simply does not work in a house of concrete despite the reviews. It has poor WIFi signal strength , doesn’t connect easily to Bose speakers and is a disaster with an Xbox one. It is also slower than a Virgin Hub 3. Really poor and customer support is Zero.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Weak signal
customer_reviews.text: Poor signal, even worse than my free virgin super hub. Bought a Asus and rick solid. This is all looks I’m afraid. And not to mention the huge footprint. Come in Linksys up your game.
customer_reviews.author: Techwizzkid

customer_reviews.title: Tech support was amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Once I got it working it’s been amazing. Best WiFi I’ve had in my house since I lived in 3 years ago! It was way more complicated to set up than I expected but that was more to do with the modem I had that the linksy’s router. The support over the phone was incredible. The chap I spoke to was patient and followed up my problem and resolved everything.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really tell you what's going on, but works when it does.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but does not really help you much if there's a connection issue somewhere. The cryptic blinking speeds of the main logo are the only indicator of what's going on and that gets boring to watch pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: mister_r

customer_reviews.title: It's OK.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few problems with dropped connections over the first two months, and the 5g signal is disappointing. I'd say it is only marginally better than the free virgin router that I had before.
customer_reviews.author: W Fox

customer_reviews.title: nothing special
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this router for 9 months, but then it started to fail, LAN was OK, but ping from WAN port was "broken". Firmware update didnt help. At first I blamed ISP, but the problem was the router. Checked in work office, same issue. Seller accepted a return but I never received a replacement or refund. Overal, I didnt notice any speed or wifi signal strenght benefits. Now a cheap gigabit tplink router works the same, same wifi coverage and speed.
customer_reviews.author: Giedrius S.

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Really good router, good signal strength, nice design and I really like that there is only one light (Linksys) on the front, looks premium. I have it for few months and didn't restarted once. App is also very nice. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Aleksandar Stosic

customer_reviews.title: Big, but capable router
customer_reviews.text: It's a router. Difficult to go into raptures about one. It's better than the cheap one that came from my ISP. It has good range and is reasonably easy to configure. It is big though. Check the dimensions and work out where you are going to put it before you buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Pete W.

customer_reviews.title: Not tri band
customer_reviews.text: This router is not as says unless I just had a bad one but activated tri band and 2.4ghz disconnected and multiple drops in connection have contacted them also let amazon support know were i got treated like a piece of poo on a shoe
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Wi-Fi speeds are good, coverage is average, and USB 3.0 feature is really bad.
customer_reviews.text: Wi-Fi speeds when near the router are fast, especially at 5 GHz, however the coverage range did not improve over my old N300 router despite the three antennas. The USB 3.0 port delivers speeds on average around 15 MB/s with an external HDD which when plugged directly into my PC read/writes at 150 MB/s.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit for 77€ and i have to say that is value for money. Easy install, good coverage (my house is 150m2 and have no dead zones) and is really fast and reliable for both 2,4GHz and 5GHZ bands. The only negative is that the web interface has minimal settings, not for an advanced user.
customer_reviews.author: Konstantinos Kaimasidis, Macedonia, GREECE

customer_reviews.title: Make sure internet connection is working before you start swapping kit.
customer_reviews.text: Once setup it works very well, setup took a while as I use Virinmedia for Broadband and getting the two items to talk to each other took quite a bit of time. Once done this router works perfectly
customer_reviews.author: MR B.

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing range considering the cost. Speed is good, but management of the router poor.
customer_reviews.author: ithelp

customer_reviews.title: Better than the EA6300
customer_reviews.text: I installed it 3 weeks ago, and it seems really stable. The installation is easy, and the speed seems OK. Unfortunately, I bought last year a Linksys EA6300, and I had so many issues without good support from Linksys (crashes, link failures with the box, unstable WiFi), that I cannot promise everything is solved, but it seems far better. Anyway, the WiFi covering is better than the 6300, and I don't need a repeater anymore in my house...
customer_reviews.author: Cedric B.

customer_reviews.title: Persistent dropouts
customer_reviews.text: Setup is easy but after a few weeks connection dropouts start. Firmware updates or resets would not resolve these issues.
customer_reviews.author: TC1000

customer_reviews.title: worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I dont usually do reviews but just had to for this router. we really struggled with wifi around the house. got this, very easy install and it works everywhere perfect, best wifi router ever..
customer_reviews.author: Stuzyk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Replacement router
customer_reviews.text: Great signal around the house, so easy to setup and great value for money.
customer_reviews.author: KOBrien

customer_reviews.title: EA7500 now good value and works very well
customer_reviews.text: Setup can be fiddly if you don't have a direct connection to the router, but the linksyssmartwifi.com link works OK with a wireless connection. The router was at 10.14.1.1 and not 192.168.1.1 as the getting started leaflet says.
customer_reviews.author: J Mulcahy

customer_reviews.title: Great Signal!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great product I haven’t had any issues. Setting it up was a little bit time consuming( because I already had a modem/router and I had to make the other one “modem only” and then use this router but overall completely satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless Hardware
customer_reviews.text: Needed tech support just to get this to work and then find out its software is limited. Threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Jamal Salam

customer_reviews.title: I was unimpressed with the signal distance I bought this ...
customer_reviews.text: I was unimpressed with the signal distance I bought this to replace an old unit and it hardly exceeds the old unit at a 1/4 of the cost
customer_reviews.author: christian l ward

customer_reviews.title: Awful. Truly awful.
customer_reviews.text: Appalling. Purchased for a huge price to resolve our wifi issues and the inconsistency is off the charts. It has now packed up for now apparent reason.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Best value for money - great router
customer_reviews.text: Great router. Simplest router replacement I ever had (backup from previous EA7300, restore to EA7500 - change router name). When Amazon declares "like new" it is practically new - very minor damage to box.
customer_reviews.author: Ran G.

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent signal and connection
customer_reviews.text: Inconsistent signal and connection via wireless. It really isn't worth the money as you won't find much of an upgrade from your ISP supplied router
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken within 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 3 months, then it broke and after hours talking to tech support linksys refused to refund.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew McGuinness

customer_reviews.title: Full control over all WiFi devices in our house
customer_reviews.text: Love the app which allows me turn on and off my kids WiFi devices. :)
customer_reviews.author: DIF

customer_reviews.title: Very Cheap Seamless Roaming Access Point when in Bridge Mode
customer_reviews.text: Working in Tandem with my EA9500 , the EA7500 in Access Point (Bridged) Mode is doing a magnificent job of providing Wi-Fi to my 1st floor and Beyond !
customer_reviews.author: Madcyril

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, good coverage
customer_reviews.text: The software is easy to setup and use. I have this plugged into my VM superhub. The two 5Ghz channels and the 2.4GHz channels are very useful for all my devices.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W

customer_reviews.title: Can't find some devices
customer_reviews.text: Nice router, good features but might not authenticate some Wifi devices
customer_reviews.author: fox1

customer_reviews.title: Purchased to replace an old and much loved Draytek box
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace an old and much loved Draytek box, the Linksys is so nice and simple to set up and connect to my BT Infinity modem. The Wifi works really well and coverage in the house and speed is a great improvement. Expensive, but woks so nicely.
customer_reviews.author: SteveL

customer_reviews.title: Effective and easy - what could be better
customer_reviews.text: Simple, easy to set up and worked straight off. The UI is straight-forward and equally easy to use. Using the simple USB3 NAS feature, which also works well.
customer_reviews.author: John Brett

customer_reviews.title: I liked it very much
customer_reviews.text: I liked it very much. I hope it will keep the good work and wont let me down:) Thank you amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Aviad Belulu

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: As an extender, works well but can't assign a static IP address.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best on market
customer_reviews.text: Only few words best describes it - THIS IS TANK !!!! VERY SOLID , FAST AND RELIABLE GEAR !
customer_reviews.author: KDM

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, WiFi signal excellent and speeds improved dramatically Over VM Hub 3
customer_reviews.author: Shaun mckenny

customer_reviews.title: Linksys MAX-STREAM EA7500
customer_reviews.text: The quality of signal i very good, but the range of this signal is rather tipical for 3x antenas.
customer_reviews.author: wceg

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great product and value, sadly had to return due to ISP issues not related to product.
customer_reviews.author: Ivo Petrov

customer_reviews.title: Simple to install and administer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and did exactly as it was advertised to do
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Tech

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Good router, bit on the large size, WiFi radius adequate but not brilliant, better out there for a bit more money
customer_reviews.author: Lord_Zycon

customer_reviews.title: Strong and simple
customer_reviews.text: Good signal strength and coverage in 70m2 apartment, easy setup. No statistics and few configurations as compared to open source tomato router firmware.
customer_reviews.author: RaFa

customer_reviews.title: Linxsy ea9500
customer_reviews.text: Very strong coverage will will not be disappointed Very happy with product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great kit for any WiFi busy household!
customer_reviews.text: Great kit for any WiFi busy household! have great coverage everywhere now. Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Lots of connection dropouts even with strong signal, being close by the router....
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: One of the best choices for 2016 router
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up , Wide range coverage , Good throughtput speed, Stable system.
customer_reviews.author: Premyot

customer_reviews.title: The first wasted two days until the elusive support team finally admitted ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought two. The first wasted two days until the elusive support team finally admitted that it was bust. The long hours in conversation with the "help prevention" desk cost me about £2,000. The other did work and performs well. A warning, they have two USB ports, A USB-3 and a USB-2. About 70% of my buying choice depended on that. It didn't work. More time wasted, more billing money lost. The Help prevention desk suddenly introduced into the conversation the concept that it should only be expected to work with drives "approved" by them. Try and find that in the marketing rubbish. But take sandwiches, You will be there for a long time, and not find it.
customer_reviews.author: johnain

customer_reviews.title: Nice Interface Awful 5GHZ Performance
customer_reviews.text: Great looking router, connected up with devices performs well, but 5GHZ range is worse than terrible 15ft across the lounge was down to 2 bar, in another room was no bar!, my old Linksys 3500 was far better than this indeed so was my HH5 Interface and setup is great I have now ordered a WRT1900ACS in the quest for better performance and returning this
customer_reviews.author: iggy

customer_reviews.title: A lousy product that  does not match the performance of my old Netgear R7000 in wifi range and throughput
customer_reviews.text: Dont get fooled by the reviews on the internet guys. This is a peace of garbage at a premium price. I bought it to replace my current Netgear R7000 router and after using it for 2 days I soon realised that wifi range is not even half of that of Netgear R000 at both 2.4 n 5 bands even after firmware upgrade and throughput too is same. It was a big downgrade so I switched back to Netgear again. Very disappointing dont waiste your money on this lousy router.
customer_reviews.author: Sanjeev Pratap Singh

customer_reviews.title: don't buy this !
customer_reviews.text: I've owned Linksys routers before & found them ok, but this is total garbage - it lasted less than 4 hours then packed up, & several reboots didn't get it working again. I could have opted for a replacement, but the router itself was a big disappointment - it had to be managed & configured by WiFi, which requires you to set up a Linksys account ( tricky when you have no internet access !) and its menu is extremely basic - no sign of any decent security options at all, & had to type in mac addresses for DHCP reservations. One to avoid!
customer_reviews.author: S  Twaddle

customer_reviews.title: An excellent router at the start but a few months in ...
customer_reviews.text: An excellent router at the start but a few months in I have started to experience a few buggy moments that also led to me reverting back to previous firmware to clear a few bugs. I feel the unit will need a factory reset and setting back up too put it back to %100 effectiveness. But even so it's well above the standards of the useless Virgin media super hub that it has replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I've got a 100mb connection and figured I'd need a good router. After first having bought a WRT1900ACS and having a terrible experience, it would hang at least once a week, this one has been working flawless for almost a year. There are always 5 to 10 devices connected to it, using netflix, torrents, etc all at the same time. No only once I had to restart it for any reason. Highly recommend. The only downside one could say is that it's quite big. But it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: cartman

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly performance, extremely powerful interface.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like this router - performance was awful for my house and software felt more like a virgin router (not a good thing) - went for the Asus ac68u instead - and that *rocks* - firmware is amazing and frequently updated. - but main thing is performance is superb - especially when paired with the asus AC68 wireless pcie card.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Only 1 primary network and a weird guest unsecured web browser login network?
customer_reviews.text: I made a massive mistake buying this. I thought I'd improve my current wireless networks. This Linksys has 1 primary secured network and 1 guest network which appears not to be secured. The guest network requires logging in by the guest using a web browser, like you do when using a public wireless access point. As far as I can see there is no improvement in signal power over my old ageing wireless router. This router seems to connect to the primary network using WPA/WPA2 where I could select to connect only with the more secure WPA2 on my old router.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W.

customer_reviews.title: Not all its cracked up to be
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review after 6 months and I am really sad that this router is not all that its cracked up to be. Cons + Parental controls do not work, lots of others in the same situation (according to thread on linksys support site) + Range worse than my old BT Home hub 5 + Tricky to set up (though I have a complicated double NAT setup as it sits behind my old home hub) + Looks terrible, wife hates it (I semi predicted this) so have moved it out of general view. Pros + Dual 5 GHz channels has alleviated saturation
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: therefore I'm stuck with a useless device. Spoken to Linksys who advised it was ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this July 13th, stopped working 10th Sept and it is now outside the Amazon return window, therefore I'm stuck with a useless device. Spoken to Linksys who advised it was Amazon's responsibility to replace the device
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: It is a big disappointment! I tried to get it work for over one month, but I did not succeed. I have really tried everything. It continuously connects and disconnects. I expected to get a premium product. I have also seen many others with the same problems in different fora.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Landelius

customer_reviews.title: Avoid purchasing drops connection and fails to restart
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these from Amazon, the first turned it's self into a plastic brick after an automatic firmware update. The second regularly drops it's WiFi connection nearly every 3 minutes and routinely fails to startup again needing the power cycling to recover. Full marks to Amazon for there returns process zero for Linksys and an unusable product.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan S.

customer_reviews.title: Great bit of kit and nice user interface too
customer_reviews.text: I was getting around 4MBPS download speeds and 5MBPS WiFi speeds with a relatively new TP-Link router. I'm now getting 7MBPS download speeds and 20MBPS WiFi speeds. Great bit of kit and nice user interface too.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R. Burkhill

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced security risk
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't until I had received the router and set it up that I noticed the guest wifi setting were a major security risk as they're unsecured and done via Web browser. When power is lost to router it also reverts the guest web based network password to the default one. Will be sending this over priced security risk back for a refund and will be purchasing a router with a proper encrypted guest network
customer_reviews.author: Digi

customer_reviews.title: abysmal,expensive,complex, avoid it
customer_reviews.text: Literally the worst product ever. Bought it as Belkin own Linksys and they typically have good reliable products. First of all it contains no modem so you need to buy a separate one. It then does not link to your existing modem without complex manual setting up. Once this is done with the extensive help of online chat with the Tech Support, it kept cutting off and caused problem to the existing modem so ended up with no internet connection for a good part of a day and wasted an entire day
customer_reviews.author: A Waheed

customer_reviews.title: Parental controls don’t work!
customer_reviews.text: On the whole this router seamed perfect. I got it to provide better parental controls over the router provided by virgin media. It failed dismally on this! You set the access times (1 hour increments only.) but they do not apply at all. Set to completely block a device and it was still working. Waste of time what happened to linksys! They are supposed to be the best on the market! I had the router in auto update mode just in case there was a update to fix the issue. No joy!
customer_reviews.author: Fisherthefrog

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Absolute rubbish, going to have to swallow my pride and plug the BT home hub back in soon
customer_reviews.author: J D

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Poor signal if you have solid walls in your house
customer_reviews.author: stuart gilmour

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Sorry guys signal kept dropping and took ages to reconnect. Returned item probably faulty.
customer_reviews.author: ernie hendy

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Sorting it out as I write but the signal is very good and for a small 4 bed is seemingly just the ticket. Replacing the Hub 3 as the router.
customer_reviews.author: Mr M OSullivan

product_meta.title: Linksys Max-Stream AC1900 MU-MIMO Fast Wireless Dual-Band WiFi Router for Home (4K UHD Streaming and Gaming, 4 Gigabit Ethernet Ports), Black
product_meta.description:
Size Name:Dual-band| Style Name:AC1900

The MAX-STREAM AC1900 Multi User-MIMO Router offers two dedicated Wi-Fi bands that deliver combined speeds of up to 1.9 Gbps. Users can manually assign high-bandwidth Wi-Fi activities such as 4K video streaming and online gaming to the high-speed 5 GHz band, while assigning older Wi-Fi devices and activities to the 2.4 GHz band.

The Linksys MAX-STREAM AC1900 Multi User-MIMO Router (EA7500) provides dual Wi-Fi bands with combined data speeds of up to 1.9 Gbps for high-bandwidth applications. Ideal for households with high Wi-Fi traffic, this Wi-Fi router allows you to simultaneously connect 12+ devices, including tablets, smartphones, 4K UHD TVs, and game consoles. Multi-User MIMO technology ensures a fast, uninterrupted Wi-Fi connection even when multiple devices are connected at the same time.

The MAX-STREAM AC1900 offers 3x3 Wireless-AC technology that delivers three simultaneous data streams for faster performance.

Additionally, four gigabit Ethernet ports and USB 3.0 and USB 2.0 ports provide high-speed data transmission for wired connections.



BOX CONTAINS
1 x Linksys EA7500 Router
3 x Antennas
UK power supply
ethernet cable
Quick Start Guide
CD-Rom and Documentation
feature_bullets: MU-MIMO Technology – Next-Gen AC Wi-Fi for uninterrupted Wi-Fi connections to multiple devices at the same time and same speed.
Smart Wi-Fi app for monitoring and managing your home Wi-Fi from anywhere. Certified Operating Systems - MacOS (10.X or higher), Windows 7, Windows 8.1, Windows 10
Combined speeds up to 1.9Gbps – 2x the speed of current Wi-Fi routers,USB 3.0 PORT
Dual-Core CPU 1.4 Ghz processor for effortlessly managing multiple Wi-Fi activities.
Four Gigabit Ethernet ports for wired speeds 10x faster than fast Ethernet.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars191 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
